title: downloading Thunderbird has corrupted a MAPI function - can you help?
content:
I constantly used email to send images to my watercolor students. Still use PICASA, a Google app that hasn't been supported in years, but still works fine, and immediately would send the selected photos via emClient email. BUT THEN i decided to download Thunderbird; it did not have certain functions i wanted (I doubt any program does), so my computer guy de-installed it. BUT THE PROBLEM is, when i went to Picasa to email photos to a class, it did not automatically open an emClient window, but gave me the choice of using Thunderbird or GoogleMail. ??? even tho Thun. was de=installed. My consultant found it was a MAPI Problem, and we have spent hours trying to fix it, with no luck. FastStone photo editing would also not work to send emails. Is it possible that downloading Thunderbird could have somehow correupted my general MAPI function?

We have spent HOURS trying to fix it, and no luck. Finally i said, let's re-install Thunderbird, and at least now i can email photos directly from FastStone. But not from Picasa, which is a huge loss to me. PLEASE, i know Picasa is ancient, but now it doesn't even give me the choice of Thun. or Gmail when I click on "Send by email". Please, can anyone help with this MAPI issue?? My consultant tried everything, but it seems to be corrupted in some way. Thank you so much!
creator: iaconetti

I want to have my most used email account at the top of the list. Is their a way to rearrange the mailbox order from top to bottom?

title: How do I download email attachments?
content: New TB user here. I sent myself some pictures from my phone, 5 or 6. I have the email on my laptop, but the images are firstly huge and go way off the screen, secondly I can't find a way to easily save them all at once. I have to scroll and right click each one and save as. Weirdly when I right cilck there's an option to "select all", great! so I chose that to select all, then right clicked and saved again. It didn't save all, just the one I clicked on?! I'm sure there must be a better way to save all attachments/images, hopefully someone can advise thanks

title: Outlook in Thunderbird - correct server settings
content: Hi, I am trying to set up Outlook in my Thunderbird v115. However, there is one last setting I am unsure about. I am using Windows 10 Home. I have two different sources of information https://www.groovypost.com/howto/setup-outlookcom-imap-windows-thunderbird/ This says ".....change the Authentication fields to Normal Password." https://www.howtogeek.com/thunderbird-has-a-problem-with-outlook-hotmail-and-live-email-addresses/ This says "........This is an odd mess. Essentially, Microsoft-owned email addresses no longer support basic authentication. Third-party clients like Thunderbird can still log in to Microsoft services, but only through OAuth. It's a good security measure—OAuth prevents a client like Thunderbird from "seeing" your Microsoft login credentials—but Microsoft's new OAuth implementation doesn't recognize Thunderbird as a desktop email client...................." There is a lot more in this article on this and another problem affecting Microsoft. What is your advice at this point in time?
creator: applikay

title: Ortak Mail
content: Merhaba, Firmamızın mailini ortak olarak kullanmak istiyoruz. IMAP ile Thunderbird' e kurulumunu gerçekleştirdim. Ancak maillerimde kullandığım etiketler, farklı bir cihazda gözükmüyor. Örneğin, bir maili, bir cihazdan kırmızı etiket yaptığımda diğer cihazdan kırmızı etiketi göremiyorum. Ortak maillerimde etiketler için nasıl çalışma yapabilirim? Daha önce bu şekilde kullanım gerçekleştirenleri gördüm. Teşekkür ederim.

title: 2024 - Why no easy option to control vertical lines in email
content: Okay. It's 2024 and after reading very stale suggestions for editing code I'm left wondering what mindset within the TB development community thinks the default of vertical lines applied during an email exchange is desired by most users? Is it really that difficult to have the default be NO lines with an easily selected option to use lines if desired? Seems like it'd be a sought after option.

title: Thunderbird:  moved group of emails to subfolder, all now missing
content:
Dear Support,

I just move a group (4-6) of files from the main inbox folder to a subfolder, and now they are all gone (some had XNotes attached; I recently installed XNotes). They are not in the folder or subfolder, and a filter of the inbox (and subfolder) fails to find them.

The general search DOES find the thread, grouping my SENT with the REC'D, but the only Location shown is SENT, and I don't know where (folder>subfolder) they actually are; the separate REC'D aren't there. (Only 1 has an XNote tag in the search, but not when I view it.)

I tried repairing (Properties> Repair) both the inbox and subfolder, but no change.

I'm running 115.9.0.

Please help!

Thanks,

Brad
creator: bnruben
